pros: They value your privacy, provide ample time off via vacation, sick days, personal time, all major holidays. Other employees are very easy to work with and get along with. Departments work well together toward a common goal. Tuition is free to your children/grandchildren, if you have them. They stand for the Constitution and free market. President Arnn has done a great deal to improve this College.
cons: Pay scale for those who do not have a College degree, but tons of experience are not paid the same as those with a degree - from anywhere - for anything.  Free tuition for those who don't have children/grandchildren - there isn't any compensation to equalize this benefit with those who do. Administration does not ask those who do the work prior to making changes to software, processes, etc. At times, money that people have donated is wasted when it does not have to be.

pros: Hillsdale College staff have a close community; many staff members have been around for years and know just about everyone else who works at the college. The ITS department is a great way to get to know students, as well - or to get a job as a student and meet the entire college staff by working on their computers!
cons:
The ITS department has relatively limited repair capabilities - it outsources for printer repairs and refer students to local computer repair shops (there aren't many in Hillsdale!) for just about anything more complicated than a hard drive replacement. 
That is not to say that ITS does not know its stuff. The department has a very knowledgeable Help Desk and an excellent Systems Administrator and Networking team that all keep the college running strong.

review_title: Good place to live, great place to work.

review_title: It's the people - and they're great.
job_title: Digital Marketing Manager in Hillsdale, MI
pros:
Hillsdale College has a great "product" in its undergraduate academics program. It's also got an inspirational mission, and one that most employees really do strive to follow.

Despite some internal politics and redtape, most faculty and staff were enjoyable to work with. I also had an amazing student intern team - my interactions with students were a highlight of my work at Hillsdale.
cons: Hillsdale's HR department is a little disorganized, and both my on-boarding and off-boarding experience were poorly managed. There's also a lack of advancement opportunities and mentorship. Finally, I believe Hillsdale can benefit from a more deliberate attempt to create a diverse work environment.

review_title: Good place to work as a student

cons: It is sometimes very difficult for younger students to get hired in the good positions.  Many freshman end up working in food services their first year, but progress over time.  First jobs are generally low pay and inflexible.
